casebody.data:
STATE EX REL. UTILITIES COMMISSION
v.
ATTORNEY GENERAL 401A18-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. April 15, 2019 Jennifer T. Harrod, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Matthew W. Sawchak, Solicitor General, Teresa L. Townsend, Margaret A. Force, Assistant Attorney Generals, James W. Doggett, Deputy Solicitor General, for Stein, Josh (Attorney General). Kiran H. Mehta, Molly McIntosh Jagannathan, Attorneys at Law, Charlotte, Christopher G. Browning, Jr., Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Duke Energy Carolinas, LLC. Matthew D. Quinn, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Sierra Club. Peter H. Ledford, Attorney at Law, Benjamin Smith, Regulatory Counsel, for N.C. Sustainable Energy Association. Gudrun Thompson, David L. Neal, Attorneys at Law, for N.C. Justice Center, et al. David T. Drooz, Staff Attorney, Lucy E. Edmondson, Staff Attorney, Raleigh, for N.C. Utilities Commission-Public Staff.

*256The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 10th of April 2019 to admit Dorothy E. Jaffe Pro Hac Vice:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 15th of April 2019."
